docs.title: Code of Conduct
docs.text:
About This Project

ADP8 is an open-source initiative that invites all users and contributors who treat others with respect.

We will not tolerate any discrimination based on race, gender, religion, nationality, or political beliefs.

Please engage with kindness and respect. Being (supposedly) right doesn't give you the right to be an asshole.

Harassment and bullying are strictly prohibited. Again, don't be an asshole.

docs.title: How to Contribute
docs.text: Thank you for your interest in contributing to this project! We appreciate your efforts and are excited to have you join our community. There are just a few small guidelines you need to follow.

docs.title: Code reviews
docs.text: All submissions, including submissions by project members, require review. We use GitHub Pull Requests (PR) for this purpose. Check GitHub Help for more information on using pull requests. Make sure to describe your changes clearly in the PR and link any relevant issues by mentioning them.

docs.title: Styleguides
docs.text: We like to follow Google C++ Style Guide and the "official" python Style Guide. We use clang for C++ and black for Python. Both formatting tools are included in the repository’s devcontainer.

docs.title: Community Guidelines
docs.text: This project and everyone participating in it is governed by the code of Conduct. By participating, you are expected to uphold this code.

docs.title: DON'T YOU DARE TO MANUALLY DEPLOY TO GH PAGES
docs.text:
If you're new to markdown, here's a ramp up markdown

If the existence of mkdocs.yml puzzles you, maybe you want to have a tour here mkdocs quickstart

Once you get here you're good to go, everything is installed in your devcontainer so no need to install anything else.

Add md files for each page, then edit mkdocs.yml accordingly.

For diagrams, drawio editor extension is enabled by devcontainer. Keep drawio files in the diagrams folder.

Unfortunately mkdocs and mkdocs-material do not support natively drawio, in order to avoid tedious devcontainer maintenance (mkdocs-drawio plugin not available with brew) export your current drawio revision as png into the images folder.

Writing documentation is important, it showcases your contribution to other people and makes their life easier understanding your work and you may even inspire them to build more things on top of that!
